page.title: 03Special Features. Buses.
page.content: { Eglingham}is renowned throughout Northumberland for the aubretia which decorates the stone walls,also for the large topiary bird at The Hall's Lodge There are two bus routes which pass through the region.Their routes are marked on the survey grid on each square through which the buses travel. One is a service bus, passing through the area three times a day in each direction. It is used by school pupils or people shopping in Alnwick and Wooler.The other is a school bus and travels from Wooler to Alnwick at about half past eight in the morning, returning after the schools' end each evening.Occasionally a double-decker is used or a yellow bus.Most of the buses are red.
